description.full:
Route is a simple representation of a HTTP route. It can be used to simply
check if a given URL matches a certain route.
description.summary:
Route is a simple representation of a HTTP route. It can be used to simply
check if a given URL matches a certain route.

description.full: Returns the compiled version of a URL.
description.summary: Returns the compiled version of a URL.

tags.name: uri
tags.description: The URI that needs to be parsed.

description.full:
: '\/+';

    if (named) {
      //
      // Previously was gratuitous, but better to just be standard
      // self.pattern += '([a-zA-Z0-9-_~%!;@=+\\$\\*\\.]+)';
      //
      // See RFC3986, or this handy table:
      // http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding#Types_of_URI_characters
      //
      self.pattern += '([a-zA-Z0-9-_~\\.%]+)';
      self.params.push(fragment.slice(1, optional ? -1 : undefined));
    } else {
      self.pattern += fragment;
    }

    if (optional) self.pattern += '?';
  });

  if (this.pattern === '^') this.pattern += '\\/';
  this.pattern += '$';

  return this.compile();
}

});

Compile our dis-assembled source to a new xRegExp instance.
description.body:
if (named) {
      //
      // Previously was gratuitous, but better to just be standard
      // self.pattern += '([a-zA-Z0-9-_~%!;@=+\\$\\*\\.]+)';
      //
      // See RFC3986, or this handy table:
      // http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding#Types_of_URI_characters
      //
      self.pattern += '([a-zA-Z0-9-_~\\.%]+)';
      self.params.push(fragment.slice(1, optional ? -1 : undefined));
    } else {
      self.pattern += fragment;
    }

    if (optional) self.pattern += '?';
  });

  if (this.pattern === '^') this.pattern += '\\/';
  this.pattern += '$';

  return this.compile();
}

});

description.full: Whether or not the route matches the given request's URL.
